reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nEnjoying this game a lot!  If you wanted more Xortex after playing it in the lab, this is it, it's Xortex and much more! A few suggestions for the developer:  Make upgrades only show up in the play area, sometimes they spawn where I can't get to them, also please include a pause button (so the player can re-oreient/de-tangle after multiple waves and an option for changing the leaderboards for each mode.  Other than a bug or 2, I'm absolutely loving the game and looking forward to future updates!
voteText: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been waiting for another game like Xortex, but more fleshed out, and this hits the mark.

Sure the graphics aren't as flashy, but they are certainly good enough. Gameplay-wise it's exactly what I wanted out of a game like this. Simple shooting, spaceships, lots of dodging and weaving, fun music, and leaderboards.

One request: As an option it would be nice to switch the spaceship to be level with the top of the ring on the controller so we can hold it with a more gun-style grip.

Thanks for the great game!!

Good music, good graphics, nice interface and menus, awesome gameplay!

I hate bullet hell games BTW, and I thought that would be a lot like it but nope! This is GREAT!

Only thing I don't quite like is that stuff too often spawn in your back? Maybe tweak it a little so it does happen but not as frequently?

Oh, and more 8 bit music please :-)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Liked Xortex in the Lab? You'll love this.

It's still got a few rough spots due to the Early Access nature, but it's completely worth the money. A bigger room with more variety of enemies, power ups like homing rockets and a second drone already have me hooked.

About the only bad thing so far is you need a spotter to tell you to start spinning the other way since you'll get tangled up moving so much.

Excellent work and I can't wait to see what else they've got planned.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWow, Frist VR game I tried that makes me feel like a kid again. I can't be alone when I say that it feels like when we all used to pretend like we shot action figures with toy space ships. I recommend this game to everyone, its a must have!

Early Access Review\n\nThis is a pretty solid title. If you enjoyed the Labs arcade game called Xortex but wanted it to be more in depth then this is your game. The creator is active on reddit and is asking for constructive criticism, always a good sign. The game has a solid foundation with permanant bonuses and upgrades, feels a bit like a 3D Gradius so far as far as the weapon upgrades go. I think this game has legs and I think its worth the money or at the very least will be shortly.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Full disclosure: I did a little beta testing for this game

If you're looking for something a bit like Xortex from The Lab, this scratches that itch.  There are three game modes to choose from.  One is a classic mode where the enemy drones fly to you. The second mode is a core defense, where you protect the core from enemy drones.  The third is an endless mode where you see how long you can stay alive.

It has some nice permanent power ups that you can choose from after killing bosses, and some temporary power ups that you can get from killing enemies.  One of the things I really appreciate is the save points after every 5 waves.  It keeps things challenging but not tedious.  Leaderboards are also available.

This game requires quite a bit of situational awareness.  The challenge isn't in the speed of the mobs and bullets, but the location of everything.  If you stop paying attention you'll find yourself in some serious trouble very quickly.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Full Disclosure: I was given a beta key to review this game. No, this does not affect my opinion of it.

Chamber 19 is an immersive and intense reimagining of the Lab's Xortex. If you liked Xortex, but felt that it lacked content, this game was made for you. Granted it doesn't have the graphics of a triple A title, however it is still leaps and bounds ahead of most indie vr games and is still only in Early Access. Definitely worth the $15.
